intro: Chiliotrichum, commonly known as the starry everlasting, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are native to southern Africa and are characterized by their showy, daisy-like flowers with white or pale blue petals. The foliage is typically covered in fine, hairy structures, giving the plant a soft, fuzzy appearance. Chiliotrichum species are often cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. They prefer well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making them adaptable to a variety of growing conditions.
